text:
Hii Everyone,
How to get the result of filter for published date and post name in blog listing page with the use of queryString ?
Would appreciate your support, Thanks!

Hello Everyone. I am new to HubSpot and not sure how to approach following problem. I have a HubSpot hosted website (<http://client.de|client.de>)  and need to do reverse-proxying to a an external url (<http://client-portal.rexx-recruitment.com|client-portal.rexx-recruitment.com>). I would have dynamic html-content on my HubSpot-website, the information of this code would be updated via requests to the external url/server. I have instructions how to do this with a website hosted on a nginx-/apache-webserver, but not with a HubSpot-cms-website. Is this possible? Thank you:)

Hi all, this is a simple one, but I can't work it out. I have a query string is sent in the url, this is pre-populating fields in a HubSpot form on a landing page. However, I wanted to also show this string in the title, and thought using the same `{{title_string}}` might, by magic :magic_wand:, just work... Any ideas?

I think this is because the field you are trying to show conditionally already exists on the form (as a hidden field).

Try removing this hidden field from the form first.
Then set up the conditional property. You should now be able to select the now-removed-property as a dependent field.

And it will automatically stay hidden as long as the condition hasn't been met.

Hi all,
Can someone help with HubSpot custom code? Specifically updating HubSpot client version within HubSpot custom code?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
